thread.title: Claims Are Construed After Interference Proceedings

author: Morris James LLP
title: Claims Are Construed After Interference Proceedings
text:
<iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=95af9032-e993-49ff-b1b8-835f9bd65505" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 
Johns Hopkins University v. 454 Life Sciences Corporation , 
Stark, J. 
The court first determines that when a party is challenging a claimâ€™s compliance with the written description requirement during an interference, the originating disclosure provides the meaning of the pertinent claim language. generating a plurality of molecules delivering the plurality of molecules of the fragment of deoxyribonucleic acid into aqueous microreactors in a water-in-oil emulsion such that a plurality of aqueous microreactors comprise a single molecule of the fragment of deoxyribonucleic acid, a single bead capable of hybridizing to the fragment of deoxyribonucleic acid, and regents essary to perform deoxyribonucleic acid amplification deoxyribonucleic acid
